answers.answer: Praying for you hun God is in control *hugs*

Thanks, dear! 5am now, first night at the hospital almost finished. I barely slept though, will try to catch up during the day.Ive been getting magnesium IV all night, managed to keep my BP normal. Just praying I dont get any spikes today.
Sending prayers your way !!! God protect you and your baby girl !!

Thanks, Patricia!! Really need some support.. We dont want to tell my and my husband's parents yet. They live overseas and just gonna stress too much!!  So we are dealing with it on our own so far..Just talked to my OB too. She said I should be preparing for c-section by Friday. They could possibly keep me until next week and do baby brain scan to see the development.But baby hasnt really grown much for the past few weeks. So thats the reason they want her out. Still hoping for a miracle though..
Sending you ladies my prayers. I hope you and your babies are okay...keep us posted with your updates.. Stay strong mommas
Hope everything goes well. God is in control. Will keep you in my prayers
Will be praying for you as well hun. May God help you and your baby and make things much much better.

I know relaxing for you is near impossible right now, but you have to try, because the more you stress the higher your bp is going to go.I also have pre-eclampsia, been hospitalized 3 times, take 5 pills a day. Thank God though my baby has not been affected so far.Stay positive and focus on your baby. Good luck and God bless!
Praying for you and your baby girl.

Thank you, girls, for your kind words and prayers. I ended up having a c-section on Sept 3. My little girl was born at 28 weeks and 715 grams. Me and the baby are doing better now. Thank God, she started feeding and gained some weight. She is very precious and a strong little girl!
Omggg when were u suppose to be due ?And I'm glad to hear you guys are doing good I'm glad your baby is ok God be with her and u I couldn't imagine going through that, stay strong and take care

Hi sweety hope you and your lil one is okay.And ill be praying that all come out well. I also can say that i truly understand you and your worries because i am a mother with diabetes and high blood pressure. So far my pressure has been good but my sugars have been on the higher side. And i am 31 weeks and worried about my lil baby girl too. But at the end we can do but so much but the man upstairs can do it all. Hope you feel better.. Your baby girl is a fighter and she knows and you know you dont mean no harm to her..

Thank you, girls, for your prayers!! My due date was Nov24. My little girl is 31 weeks now. She is doing ok. We are staying hopeful and just taking it day by day. She is eating milk through a tube now and started gaining weight. That was a big deal for us so  very greatful to God for that!! Also, she started opening her eyes and looking around a few days ago. I also had several opportunities to hold her on my chest. Of course, there are issues that come up here and there.. But, thank God, so far its mainly something that van be treated or should fix itself when she grows a bit.Thank you again. She is my little angel and Im very grateful to have her in my life.Just want to say to all mamas to be: take it easy, listen to your body, if something bothers you call your doctor right away. You are entering the final stretch!! Wishing you all an easy timely delivery and healthy babies!!
I'm so happy you guys are doing well. Your baby girl do great. Just curious what state are you in? You seem to be at a wonderful hospital. Good luck

Thanks, Desteon!We are in California. She is in Miller's Childrens Hospital in Long Beach. They have a large NICU department. We are very greatful to all the nurses and doctors! They are very caring and knowledgable  ))

question: Laying in hospital bed now... Need to let it out..(Sorry for long post).Im 28 weeks. Went for my regular doctor's checkup today. So far my pregnancy has been going very well so what happened today just put me in shock.First, my blood pressure was 140/80. Then doctor did US and said baby measured small. She immediately sent me to the hospital for additional checks and monitoring. I was still hoping that everything would be fine.Got to the hospital, they put me in hospital gown, checked BP. It was 180/110 at that point. Next thing, bunch of doctors/nurses, 2 shots for lowering BP and 1 steroid shot for baby's lungs. BP still stayed high, got hooked up to IV with magnesium and started talking emergency C-section if BP doesnt go down.. My baby's only 1lb7oz though..So now, Ive been at the hospital for 13 hours, exhausted, worried, hungry (havent eaten for 16 hours)..Thank God my BP went down. Im still hooked up to magnesium though. Im scared that even if my BP stays low, I might have to do c-section for a 28 week baby who already measures small. They say that one you have this desease, it only gets worse..Also have high protein (3.2) in my blood which is one of the symptoms. My blood tests for other symptoms all came back fine though. Thank God!!Its 1am now, gonna try to sleep. Please pray for me and my little girl. If you have any preeclampsia stories, Id love to hear!!
title: Emergency hospitalization with preeclampsia
